page.title: 01INTRODUCTION (1)
page.content: This area includes much of the Brighouse town centre, the industrial area, a number of housing developments (both local authority and privately owned) and large tracts of open land. It touches Elland on its westernmost side, the outskirts of Huddersfield on the South and Clifton on the North East side of the town. The population of Brighouse is about 35000. Local industry includes light and medium engineering, brickmaking and flour milling. Industrial control valves, made in Brighouse, are sent all over the world. Textiles,formerly its mainstay, are now in a state of rapid decline. The twin silos of Sugden's flour mill dominate the local skyline, as they have for more than a century. Other landmarks, former textile mills, have been destroyed by fires during recent years.
